item.title: Centralization and decentralization are not the same dialectic spectrum as control and cooperation
item.description: This is quite often confused People tend to think that [[notes/Structure is layers of process|structure and process are bad, when what they’re really chafing at is control, hierarchy (layers of control)]].

item.title: Clarity is an equalizing force
item.description: The people who benefit from lack of clarity are those already in power. [[Implicit structures, processes, and powers always exist]], it’s just a matter of if they’ve been made explicit through clarity or not.

item.title: Effective maps
item.description: You can’t measure the effectiveness of a map based on its resolution or how well it was constructed. These are useful things to know, but the effectiveness of maps is measured based on it getting you where you want to go.

item.title: Gamechanger
item.description: Post-scarcity [[Science Fiction]] novel by [[L.X. Beckett]]

item.title: Hundreds of examples beats millions of words
item.description: The most powerful levels of expertise are beyond the conscious mind, intuition that often can’t be explained. Because of this the best way to teach is with high quality, high quantity examples.

item.title: Morning pages
item.description: I write at least 500 words every morning on a variety of topics. Typically selecting my topic is the process of one [[notes/Pomodoro technique|pomodoro]] and writing is a second one.

item.title: Note-taking is an art practice
item.description: Creating and sharing notes is an art pratice. Like painting or writing music, it requires creativity, discipline, skill, and experimentation. Digital tools, much like with art or music, enable more people to craft a practice, and in more elaborate ways.

item.title: Notes on planning
item.description: Write about NotePlan and [[Timeblock your tasks|timeblocking]]

item.title: Organizational objectives should be unique to an organization
item.description: “Build a delightful product”? That’s vague to the point of being meaningless. No company does not want to build a delightful product, it’s safe to assume everybody has that goal as a base level.

item.title: Plan systems on a weekly time horizon
item.description: There’s an unresolvable tension between two poles: integration, completeness, complexity modularity, focus, simplicity When building tools or systems it’s really easy to start getting knotted up in your own threads trying to weave a solution that satisfies (impossibly), both of these poles.

item.title: Pomodoro technique
item.description: I’m a huge proponent of the pomodoro technique. I use the tool Focus for Mac to simultaneously block distractions and keep track of my poms.

item.title: Split skills into small chunks and move them to expertise quickly
item.description: The appropriate size of skill is something you can move from new knowledge to mastered in 3 x 45-90 min sessions.

item.title: Structure, not process
item.description: Structure is what, when, where, why, and how to do a thing. For example, proposals go in a certain Notion database, they use a specific template, they require certain metadata.

item.title: Write to learn
item.description: Writing is akin to teaching, in that forces you to shine a bright light on the areas you have illusory understanding of.
